text1: Early US Light tank, has 2 Small slots and a built-in hull 30cal.
Early US Light tank, has 1 Medium slots, a built-in pintle 30 cal and a built-in hull 30cal.
Early US Medium tank, has 1 Medium slot and 4 built-in hull 30cals.
Early to Mid US Medium tank, has 1 Medium slot, a built-in 75mm, and a built-in roof 30cal.
Mid to Late US Medium tank, has 1 Large slot, a built-in pintle 50cal, and a built-in hull 30cal.
Late US Medium-Heavy tank, an overall upgrade to the Sherman's armor at the cost of mobility.
Late US Heavy tank, derived from several tank projects meant to improve upon the Sherman.
General purpose supply truck, transport 2 Squads of "Fighter" wings.
A more purposeful modification of the supply truck to carry fuel over people.
Heavy duty armored supply train, has 3 Squads of "Fighter" wings, 1 Medium slot, 5 Small slots, and 7 built-in 30cals.
Heavy duty freight train, has a squad of "Fighter" wings, 1 Medium slot, 1 Small slot, and 4 built-in 30cals.
Early German Light tank, has 1 Small slot.
Standard M2a2 turret, equipped with a 50cal HMG. The loading mechanism has been automated, it feeds in one 45 round belt at a time while holding 105 rounds in reserve total.
Non-standard modified M2 turret, equipped with quad 50cal HMGs. The loading mechanism has been automated, it feeds in 2 pairs of 45 round belts at a time while keeping 210 rounds in reserve total.
Non-standard modified M2a2, equipped with dual 50cal HMGs. The loading mechanism has been automated, it feeds in 4 pairs of 45 round belts at a time while keeping 425 rounds in reserve total.
Standard M2a2 turret, equipped with a 30cal LMG.  The loading mechanism has been automated, it feeds in one 50 round belt at a time while keeping 250 rounds in reserve total.
Standard M2-M3 turret, equipped with a 37mm. The loading mechanism has been semi-automated, it has a ready rack of 5 rounds that is reloaded manually one at a time.
Standard M3 Lee hull turret, equipped with a 75mm. The loading mechanism has been semi-automated, it has a ready rack of 5 rounds that is reloaded manually one at a time.
Standard M4 Sherman turret, equipped with a 75mm. The loading mechanism has been semi-automated, it has a ready rack of 5 rounds that is reloaded manually one at a time.
Non-standard custom made Sherman turret, equipped with quad 20mm autocannons. The loading mechanism has been automated, it feeds one 30 round belt at a time while keeping 120 rounds in reserve total.
Standard M4 Sherman turret, equipped with a 76mm. The loading mechanism has been semi-automated, it has a ready rack of 5 rounds that is reloaded manually one at a time.
Non-standard modified M4 turret, equipped with a 105mm. The loading mechanism has been semi-automated, it has a ready rack of 5 rounds that is reloaded manually one at a time.
Standard M26 Pershing turret, equipped with a 90mm. The loading mechanism has been semi-automated, it has a ready rack of 5 rounds that is reloaded manually one at a time.
Standard Hull 30cal, you might see this for many built-in weapons.  The loading mechanism has been automated, it reloads in of 50 round belts at a time while keeping 250 rounds in reserve total.
Standard BAR, what does that stand for again?
Be careful to not get space garand thumb, the cold will snap it off.
Standard Pz II turret, equipped with a 20mm autocannon. The loading mechanism has been automated, it feeds in one 10 round belt at a time while holding 20 rounds in reserve total.
